intro: Scariola tetrantha, commonly known as the four-stemmed scarletroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Scariola tetrantha is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, woodland habitats. Its name refers to the four branches that emerge from the base of the plant.
